text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel welcome back to my
kitchen the holidays are just around the
corner and I have a really good noodle
recipe for you guys today I'm going to
show you guys how to make a pan-fried
soy sauce noodle recipe using leftover
turkey so if you guys have a lot of
leftover turkey or leftover chicken
whatever leftover meats you have from
the holidays and you like noodles this
is the recipe for you today's video is
also sponsored by Pearl River Bridge
they sent me some sauces to use for this
recipe the first one is a superior light
soy sauce which is a really great
everyday light soy sauce and the second
one is a mushroom flavored and dark soy
sauce and that's gonna really help
caramelize the noodles give you that
dark caramel color and give it that nice
umami flavor you can also buy these on
Amazon and save yourself a trip to the
grocery store so with that let's get
started for the ingredients we'll need 8
ounces of Hong kong-style noodles or egg
noodles and since I bought mine fresh
and not frozen
I'm going to boil them for exactly one
minute then drain and rinse them under
cold water to stop the cooking process
just make sure to drain the noodles
while before setting them aside so they
don't get soggy next let's prep the
vegetables I like to use about 1 cup of
bean sprouts a few stalks of scallions
thinly sliced lengthwise and about half
a cup of yellow onions for the meat I'm
using leftover turkey breast that's
fully cooked and have gone to head to
hand tear them into smaller bite-sized
pieces now it's time to make our soy
sauce base in a small bowl add 3
teaspoons of Pearl River Bridge superior
light soy sauce 1 TSP of Pearl River
Bridge mushroom flavored superior dark
soy sauce 1/2 a TSP of sesame oil 1/2 a
teaspoon of sugar 1 TSP of rice wine 2
tablespoons of water and 1 teaspoon of
minced garlic mix and stir to dissolve
the sugar and now we're ready to cook in
a hot wok or other nonstick frying pan
start by adding a few tablespoons of
canola oil and spread the noodles in a
layer over the pan pan fry the noodles
for a few minutes on each side to make
them lightly crispy and continue to toss
until some of the
edges are lightly brown then turn off
the heat and set the noodles aside on a
plate next stir-fry the yellow onions in
a bit of oil until they start to become
translucent then add in the noodles and
continue to stir-fry for another minute
during this time feel free to add more
oil as needed along the way now it's
time to add our soy sauce base for the
sauce directly over the noodles and be
prepared to quickly toss and mix the
noodles until evenly combined your
noodles should now start to caramelize
and turn a beautiful dark brown color
next add in the bean sprouts the turkey
and finally the green onions mix and
toss for another two to three minutes
until the bean sprouts are just
translucent and as a final step add some
salt and white pepper to taste and
you're done then serve the noodles hot
and feel free to garnish with a side of
cilantro
[Music]
that is how you make my pan-fried soy
sauce noodles with Turkey I hope you
guys enjoyed this noodle dish once
you've mastered this you can go ahead
and switch it up and make it your own
for example I would recommend adding
some seafood to it you could use some
shrimp and maybe some scallops or even
make it spicy by adding some chili
garlic sauce I'm angel thank you guys so
much for watching if you guys like this
video recipe don't forget to give me a
thumbs up and if you want to see more
videos like this subscribe to my youtube
channel
angel Long's kitchen until then take
care and I will see you in the next one
bye for now
[Music]
